word_mean: ［拉］腐质，碎屑：物质或组织经磨耗或分解后产生或剩留的颗粒物质，可以是有机物或无机物，取决于原先物质的性质。另见biodetritus
植物和动物残体被分解成的破碎的颗粒状有机物质。

sentence.Network_en: organic detritus from fish and plants
Detritus usually consists of gravel, sand and clay.
sentence.Network_cn: 岩屑通常是由砂砾, 沙和粘土组成的.

sentence.Network_en: A channel is no sooner cut than it chokes in its own detritus.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个河道刚被切割了不久,很快又被它自己的碎屑物质所充塞.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...风化的产物)目录1词语解释2生物术语3地质术语陆源碎屑内碎屑火山碎屑1词语解释碎屑(detritus)该词原是泛指整体破裂后的小片引申义，细小而繁多(的事)。2生物术语在生物学上，则用于表示生物体的碎片，残骸、排泄物和它们的普通分解产物。实际上，其中总是混有.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent. (in the sense 'detrition'): from French détritus, from Latin detritus, from deterere 'wear away'

entry.def: Detritus is the small pieces of rubbish that remain after an event has finished or when something has been used.

means.word_mean: 1. the remains of something that has been destroyed or broken up
2. loose material (stone fragments and silt etc) that is worn away from rocks
